intro: Micropyxis tenella, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures that trap small aquatic organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are narrow and often submerged, while its flowers are small and usually pink or purple in color. Micropyxis tenella plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web and maintaining water quality.
